review_title: A stepping stone, not a career builder - overworked and toxic
job_title: Professional Support Staff in Essen, North Rhine-Westphalia
pros: Great vacation time per year, health benefits and retirement plan. Most of the middle management/directors/professors and professional support staff (admins) work hard and care about the mission of students. There are some decent professional development courses offered to faculty and staff.
cons: A lot of administrative level positions are filled with people who shouldn't manage a department, and there's no real recourse/listening for issues. People at the bottom are often overworked and loaded with tasks that should be a higher level role but never given the opportunity to advance. The retention rates are bad because the professional development and programs to help move people up, even across the university, aren't in place. They will let people sit in one role for close to 10 years and then act surprised when they decide to leave for a higher paying job, and then blame the employee for not seeking help with their supervisor. It's a lot of crap to wade through. Compared to other universities, the pay really isn't that great.

job_title: Student Assistant in Allendale, MI
pros: I worked for numerous programs over the course of six years as a student employee; my last 3.5 years as a student administrative assistant were extremely valuable! I was lucky to work under the direction of three incredible leaders for a program on Pew campus who supported my academic and personal goals. I'll always be grateful for their mentorship. 100% recommend working on-campus as a student if the opportunity is there!
cons: Low pay may be difficult for some students, however, building rapport and being able to maintain your position for multiple semesters can help you to earn raises. Also, once you graduate you are obviously no longer eligible to be a student employee but building connections can create long-lasting opportunities for the future.

review_title: Could be worse, could be better
job_title: Student Worker in Allendale, MI
pros: Work around class schedule, easy work, raise after 2 semesters, not too hard to get days off (well in advance only) or extra shifts, was very nice that since it was for the university they only took out 10-20 bucks a paycheck for taxes, only work every other weekend
cons: Raise after 2 semesters, but only 15 cents and has nothing to do with performance. So no matter how hard you work, slackers get the same raise.  No training, thrown right into the lions den on day 1. Rules for taking days off for unexpected reasons like sickness, death in family, etc are unreasonable. God forbid you have a weak immune system or a snow storm in west Michigan. Maybe it's just me, but I refuse to risk my life for my job. Luckily it never came to that for me, but I feel sorry for those that it did.

review_title: Relaxing and Fun Place to Work
job_title: Network Systems Engineer in Allendale, MI
pros: Great benefits, extremely flexible schedules, holiday breaks, beautiful campuses, and an environment that encourages you to better yourself. Free gym memberships, discounts at hundreds of local shops, free education for yourself, half off for your family, free bus transport to save on transportation costs. All around fun place to work.
cons: It's education, so you can pretty much expect to make about 80% of what "real-world" jobs pay, but the lower pay is compensated by better benefits and tons of time off. There's the usual nepotism and favoritism, it can be hard to get ahead around here if you are not a social butterfly and/or related to someone higher up the corporate ladder.

review_title: There are goof things, with a few exceptions....
job_title: Custodian in Allendale, MI
pros: It is a diverse culture and if you interested in working in an environment that supports diversity then this is the place for you. I work as one of the Facility Services staff and while our jobs are not too difficult the students and some staff members have a tendency to make it less enjoyable. Mainly the pros are Reasonable expectations, reasonable management, decent working conditions....
cons: The cons mainly consist of poor communication between departments (or restrictive communication) poor management as far as the building managers go, student workers are not held accountable for their misdeeds, and lack of environmental controls in housing and athletic areas.

job_title: in Allendale, MI
pros: Genuine commitment to students, pleasant campuses, and generally humane physical work environment. The benefits packages are tiered depending on what type of position you have....but if you land a non-temporary, non-adjunct job in the "professional" or academic categories, the benefits are quite nice.
cons: The balance of pros/cons here, like at most academic institutions, tends to be local to one's own department and the politics and competencies within it -- so if your department is well-managed and full of interesting and sane people, it's great. Otherwise, you can expect ongoing frustration.

review_title: Great experience for responsible employees who want to work hard!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Allendale, MI
pros: GVSU provides ample opportunity for advancement, both for student and career positions. Wonderful people to work with, very dedicated to their students and employees.
cons: While campus is very nice, Allendale can be a bit dull if you're looking to stick around for a long time. However, the surrounding suburbs, along with Grand Rapids make up for it. Also, assignments tend to take a long time to trickle down from higher-level management (ie department heads), which muddles the work that is assigned to the lowest level, which is normally students. Work tends to be re-done, and time is wasted too often. Other than that, no problems!

job_title: Housing in Allendale, MI
pros: Learned a lot! Was tested nearly everyday through interactions and utilized problem solving skills every time I clocked in. Met some amazing people!
cons: I felt like I worked in wrecked workplace, nothing felt organized or thought out. Coworkers often didn't communicate leaving holes in our service. Extra work was often given to my particular office which made my job more stressful than it already was.

review_title: GVSU --  Better Than Nothing, But Not Much...
job_title: Manager in Allendale, MI
pros: Collegial setting.  Benefits can be good, though University makes liberal use of adjunct appointments including for staff, eliminating the need to provide job security or full benefits.
cons: Incompetent management at various levels.  University-wide initiatives often implemented hastily and without adequate communication, training, or quality assurance evaluation or feedback.   For the most part, various departments/divisions are run like "fiefdoms," and staff treated like chattel.  Management self-preservation is paramount at all costs.

job_title: Student Graphic Designer in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I worked at an office of GVSU as a student and I truly felt like I was treated as a professional. I was given a heavy workload relevant to the career I was seeking after college. The internship provided me with tons of portfolio pieces and practical experience for a professional job out of college. Above all, I had an awesome supervisor who has been helping me with the job search and interview process.
cons: Student workers at GVSU aren't allowed to continue working after graduation. And there wasn't a position for me to move up to in that office

job_title: Campus Dining Student Manager in Allendale, MI
pros: Campus Dining jobs work around your class schedule and any extracurricular activities that you may have; as long as you communicate with your managers, there shouldn't be any scheduling issues. Meals for every 4 hours that you work. Great coworkers. Maximum shift length is 5 hours.
cons: It's three write-ups and then you're out; some locations may give leeway, but they're trying to emphasize that this is a job. High turnover rate so shifts can become stressful. Managers may try to call you in. You must work during final exams (the schedule will change to match your preferences); think about this: everyone still needs to eat

job_title: Associate Professor in Allendale, MI
pros: Growing vibrant university in a time when other institutions are struggling.  As a public university, GVSU provides access and affordability for students across a financial spectrum.
cons: The adjunctification of the profession is widespread, and though it may not be as severe of a problem at GVSU, it is  certainly present.  Aspects of campus culture have improved from being very conservative in the past, to less institutionally conservative.

review_title: A place of resources and life, people are content.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Allendale, MI
pros:
Stability of Allendale - primarily from the school's institution. 
Stability with Grand Rapids as a growing metropolitan. Grand Valley has the advantage of being both "University of Michigan" creating Allendale to be its own type of "Ann Arbor" and "Wayne State University" utilizing Grand Rapids as its own type of "Detroit". 
There is flexibility with work schedule and life balance. This come from a good mix of professionals and college students existing and utilizing the same space. 
Grand Valley capitalizes on the opportunity to progress with Grand Rapids
cons: Change takes time and the right people supporting. Understand the politics to have change occur.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Strong commitment among the graduate studies program to ensure that GA's are getting the relevant experience that they need.  My GA is rigorous, necessitates problem solving, and has provided a great opportunity to complete my MBA.
cons: Politics are always present in a university setting, but at this level things are fairly insulated.  Some of my fellow GA's are exposed to it more than I am, which is a credit to my department, and it has caused some resentment among my colleagues.

review_title: A wonderful academic environment, but a disappointing job.
job_title: Affiliate French Professor in Allendale, MI
pros: The atmosphere is great; people are friendly and strive for quality in education and in student life.
cons: The affiliate position is exploitative and does not provide the ideal learning environment for students.  The course load of these instructors is unreasonable and not adequately compensated.  Tenured professors make a great deal more money for what appears to be less work, and treat affiliates as their inferiors.

review_title: Not bad, make friends with higher ups, make sure your work is noticed
job_title: Booth Attendant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Great with scheduling, very friendly, most supervisors are good, benefits can be great, if you want to work in higher education a job here can be very rewarding
cons: In-fighting amongst supervisors is bad and you will get caught between their ego battles, promotions are hard to come by if your part-time or temporary. No benefits if you are part-time or temporary and they like to string you along until you quit or drop your promotion request

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Allendale, MI
pros:
Great work life balance (may depend on area)
Many very loving people still make it feel like a family
Vacation time & Holidays are hard to beat
Overall benefits are still pretty amazing, although they have declined a tad in recent years
Freedom to innovate (again may depend on area)
cons:
Salary is likely lower than that of the private sector
Politics do play it's role every now and then, but not in a soul crushing way

job_title: Campus Recreation
pros: Professional development, personable, student peers. Flexible schedule. Adequate training. Raises every year of working there. On-campus so I didn't even need a car my first year working there.
cons: Minimum wage pay to start. Only can work there as a student due to frequent cuts to professional staff. Sometimes feel lost in a sea of student workers who don't all necessarily want to be there. Recent interns are not dedicated to their job and it makes the office look unprofessional.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: really pushed student workers to be critical thinkers. Expected more of us than just to show up and do our jobs, which really helped.
cons: deparment didn't see the work we actually did, nor did they care to even try. Really discouraging and hard to feel like a part of the IT team overal

review_title: Working for GVSU was the best experience an undergraduate could have.
job_title: Student Worker in Allendale, MI
pros: Grand Valley does a great job at prepping their student to succeed in their future endeavors. They allow flexibility to students who have sports or class projects. You get the opportunity to meet people that will influence you the rest of your life.
cons: Pay as an undergrad is not the best. Some jobs may require you to work very short shifts to fill and gaps in the schedule.

job_title: in Allendale, MI
pros: Free tuition for all employees and 50% tuition benefit for dependents and domestic partners. Flex work schedules. 2 weeks PTO in December for Holiday Closures.
cons: No consistent promotion schedules. No internal opportunities for promotion UNLESS you are "in" with Senior Management. Racial disparities in terms of top leaders.

review_title: Grand Valley is a large school that tries to function like a small school. Staff are very unprofessional.
job_title: Student Worker in Allendale, MI
pros: If you don't value quality, professionalism, or making a name for yourself, Grand Valley is a great place to work!
cons: Very disorganized and impossible to find information you need.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Allendale, MI
pros:
-Professors support you 
-The OURS gives numerous opportunities for you to present your research
-Since most jobs are 10 hours a week minimum, it’s a good work/homework balance
cons:
-You have to be self-motivated and highly organized because there is not much direction given from above
-Sometimes the work you do seems irrelevant to the project 
-The pay for many undergraduate assistants is funded through grants and not covered by the school, so you may have a job one semester but not the next

review_title: Great job to have as a student
job_title: IT Consultant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Can manage your own hours between classes, or full time if you have a semester off. Pays generously compared to other student positions. Multiple levels of promotion and leadership.
cons: Upper management chooses the cheapest IT contracts, therefore the faculty equipment is often junk and if you work in IT, you have to deal with it.

job_title: Summer Camps & Conferences Manager in Allendale, MI
pros: This was a great opportunity to take on a first time management position as a student.  You learn to manager a staff and work with guests.  It is a great opportunity for a hospitality student.
cons: In order to move up out of a student position you really have to have at least a masters degree, even for positions that don't have anything to do with education.

job_title: Student Director Speech Lab in Allendale, MI
pros: Nice people, positive work environment competitive salary. I have worked here for 3 years and have enjoyed coming to work.
cons: could have more autonomy, feels like I am being micromanaged at times. Sometimes it feels like management doesn't listen or just tells you what you want to hear instead of trusting their people.

job_title: Clerical/Administrative in Allendale, MI
pros: Great health, life, vision, dental benefits, competitive wages, lots of perks for employees, lots of activities on campus such as concerts, lectures, great fitness center free to employees. Lots of opportunities to eat really good food. The work itself is great, exposure to a diverse population, mind-opening and collegial.
cons: It can be a difficult commute to the Allendale campus in the winter if the weather is bad.

review_title: Micromanaged, soul sucking, below market pay
job_title: Server Support Technician in Allendale, MI
pros: Health insurance was pretty great.  I was able to unplug 100% after work (required to stay sane)
cons: With only a few exceptions, the IT department is filled with people who do nothing all day other than trying to justify their own existence at the university. As soon as someone gained power/control over something, they silo'd themselves and refused to share knowledge to make themselves seem more valuable. The people in charge are all best friends, so don't expect anything to ever change.

job_title: Research Analyst in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Very good company to work for that values business and other research endeavors that help support students, faculty, staff and the greater community.
cons: Pretty hands off, but this can be a good or bad thing. Faculty will be available to help whenever though, so one shouldn't feel lost or not supervised.

review_title: 10 years a Laker, sorry to be leaving but growth demands it
job_title: Academic and Research Advisor in Allendale, MI
pros: good school, friendly folks, reasonable working conditions, supportive colleagues, shared vision of aiming for excellence in teaching quality, affordable tuition
cons: invisible administrative decision making leaves faculty & staff unsure why decisions were made the way they were, and what the priorities actually are

job_title: Audio Visual Technician/Student Technician in Westland, MI
pros: Flexible schedule for students, allowed for easy balance with work and school. Had very helpful and kind bosses.
cons: Having to report to work even if there was a snow day and the weather was terrible. Trying to work during finals week.

job_title: Cot in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: You're going to work with the best and brightest students the mid-west has to offer. GVSU is very competitive these days and students are achieving great lengths to get here.
cons: Can't think of much. HR can be overwhelming sometimes.  All supervisors have a different culture they portray in their office (for COT positions).

review_title: I have worked for GVSU for over 8 years. There have been a few bumps along the way but overall, it is an enjoyable place
job_title: Department Coordinator in Allendale, MI
pros: Good people in individual departments. Management is generally reasonable.
cons: Some of the policies seem to be from when the school was a small college.  Some ideas seem out of date

review_title: Fun academic environment, flexible schedule depending on your position, good place to gain work experience.
job_title: IT Customer Support in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Pretty good culture, I like my team and team leaders.
cons: A little too loose in some processes and the do's and dont's, can be hard to navigate some more complicated tasks. Have to keep asking higher ups to avoid assuming the wrong thing. Lack of organized documentation.

job_title: Librarian in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: I really enjoyed working with faculty outside of the libraries, but everything inside of the libraries is completely mismanaged.
cons: The management in the library is incredibly incompetent, discriminatory, and insular. They waste money on resources, break employment laws regularly, and managers cover other's leadership mistakes instead of reporting them. The Dean is completely incomprehensible and an embarrassment to the university.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Working at a Graduate Assistant is an excellent way to finance your education and gain work experience at the same time. GVSU is very supportive and wants to see me succeed in my graduate degree program.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Resident Assistant in Allendale, MI
pros: You will have your room and board paid for without having to do much work.
cons: Managed by Marxists and radical social justice warriors. Encourage "dialogue" but will fire anyone with the wrong opinion. Training for RA's is essentially social justice indoctranation.

job_title: Student Worker in Allendale, MI
pros: Very flexible, accommodating, easy commute, friendly coworkers
cons: Minimum wage, no opportunity to work on the weekends or past five o'clock. Other than that I can only say positive things about my experience as a student worker.

review_title: An excellent academic environment to work and grow as an educator.
job_title: Visiting Professor in Allendale, MI
pros:
Progressive thinking faculty.
Student centered administration
Not a research driven environment, but education focused
Continually expanding (ex. new library being finished, braking ground on a new lab building)
cons:
hurt by state budget cuts
facilities feel crowded do you constant expansion

job_title: Resident Assistant in Grandville, MI
pros: Both the Allendale location and Grand Rapids location are a great place. The campus is beautiful. A great place to work while going to school.
cons: Not many complaints. Although, your experience will differently depend on how professional your Living Center Director. This could either make it or break it.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in San Antonio, TX
pros: There was a good amount of flexibility in one's work schedule.  The work was challenging and dynamic.
cons: The department was small and very political.  Too much effort was spent on perceptions rather than focusing on results.

job_title: Senior Technical Consultant in Allendale, MI
pros:
-Student position, worked around class schedules
-Good pay
-Reliable
cons:
-Cannot work this position  after graduating
-If the university is closed, you don't come into work, so you lose some work hours
-Some of the professors are rather rude just because you are a student
-No benefits since you are just a student

review_title: Treats their student employees like family
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Allendale, MI
pros: I got super close with my fellow students while working together. I also got really fantastic hours that suit my class schedule and life. I also loved having flexible hours during exam week.
cons: I see no cons to working at GVSU while being a student there.

review_title: The W.C was excellent in terms of community, compensation, and scheduling.
job_title: Consultant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Seeing your work impact the writing of students, keeping a social life during school, getting to know coworkers with similar interests
cons: Unrealistic expectations from students looking for help

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: You have an opportunity to work in academic and professional environment. You have a chance to develop your research interests. Good area and facilities to conduct research projects and improve your professional skills.
cons: You are not independent at your work. Your work does not always contribute the final results.

job_title: Visiting Faculty in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: An emerging university in a flourishing city.  A relatively younger faculty pool.
cons: Internal politics among faculty and spoiled students

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Allendale, MI
pros: Easy money, work around your class schedule, meet ton of new people. ability to get lots of hours in the summer time
cons: cant use phones or do any homework, super boring, there is very little what you can take away from this job, not any development

job_title: Student Worker in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The people are genuine, professional, and accommodating. I have almost worked here for two years, and throughout my time I have had a wonderful experience. Grand Valley is a fantastic university to work for!
cons: There are none that I can think of.

review_title: GVSU has been wonderful to me, a great experience
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Great benefits for full-time employees, tuition coverage for graduate assistants, flexibility, amazing people, state-of-the-art facilities, highly accredited business college, great resources, free workout facilities
cons: Too many technical difficulties on a regular basis, students can crowd the work space,

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The biggest pro is that the Graduate Assistantship pays for the tuition and you are able to use your skills at work.
cons: The institution is not very dynamic for  workplace, therefore it is not challenging or very interesting to work here.

job_title: Audio Visual Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Works around my schedule. Flexible too
cons: Management isn’t good. Partial to their favorites in a very blatant and disrespectful manner. Pay isn’t nearly enough

job_title: Assistant Professor in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The benefits are great for full-time faculty and there is a lot of enrichment opportunities.
cons: Salary is low compared to other universities.

job_title: IT Technician in Allendale, MI
pros: Great flexibility and Team bonding. co-workers are very easy going and always ready to help. Certainly the best campus job there.
cons: I absolutely dislike the vest you have to put on and the IT gadgets need some replacement

review_title: Great overall people and work environment
job_title: Social Media Coordinator in Allendale, MI
pros: Great co-workers, good schedule, I was a student athlete plus took 15 credits and they worked around what was best for me!
cons: Based off my experiences I wouldn't say there was many cons

job_title: Tour Guide in Allendale, MI
pros: Gains professional and customer service skills. After this job, you will be able to speak in large crowds comfortably.

job_title: Academic Tutor in Allendale, MI

cons: Not as accelerated a program as other schools, undergrad oriented, harder transitioning for graduate programs.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Build great relationships with faculty
cons: Work load can vary from week to week depending on the needs of faculty and the time of the semester. Finals week can become overwhelming juggling school and proctoring exams.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Allendale, MI
pros: Great place to work! T Haas as a gem, and they are very supportive towards their employees.
cons: It's a fast growing university, so sometimes people figure out policies etc as they grow.

job_title: Professor in Allendale, MI
pros: Working with bright young students is the best!
cons: Too much bureaucracy.

review_title: I'm working as a Teaching Assistant in School of Engineering
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Allendale, MI
pros: As a teaching assistant I'm not only helping the Under Grad students, but I'm learning a lot.

job_title: Consultant in Allendale, MI
pros: Excellent flexibility, though this is department specific.

job_title: Student Worker in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Great work life balance, continuing education is a focus, great mobility throughout company

job_title: Project Specialist in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Loved the office culture and ability to explore different roles within the department.
cons: None! To this day, this has been the most rewarding employment experience I have ever had.

job_title: IT Tech in Grand Rapids, MI
